intro: Argyrochosma nivea var. flava, commonly known as the yellow mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, and the flowers are white or yellow, depending on the variety. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cold, dry environments.
